text: Pope Gregory VI (; died 1048), born Johannes Gratianus, was an Italian priest of the Roman Catholic Church and the 149th Pope from 1 May 1045 until his abdication on 20 December 1046. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2013-3-21. ==Early life== Johannes Gratianus was born in Rome, but the date of his birth is not known."Pope Gregory VI," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2013-3-21. == Pope == Gratianus became pope in 1045; and he took the name Gregory. There was a problem in the way he became pope. Gregory VI willingly resigned; and then he retired to a monastery.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1838). "Gregory VI," Penny cyclopaedia, Vol. 11, p. 444. Hildebrand was the papal chaplain.
